results.title: McFeast: breasts
results.creator_credit: Damian Davis, Mark Fitzgerald and ABC
results.brief_description: Elle McFeast, (Lisbeth Gorr) with cohorts, Mark Warren, Mikey Robins and John Hinde explore the issue of breasts. A joyous celebration of women and their bodies. A host of stars including Kate Ceberano and Kate Fischer, as well as comments from people on the street, discuss the issue of cleavage in an unexploitative way.

results.title: Mcbus
results.creator_credit: Derek May, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This is a “nowhere tour” of Montreal, a sort of parody of the world we live in, where all is confusion, aimlessness and noise. A recurring figure in the film is a Highland piper walking his beat on a lonely patch of ground beneath an elevated highway. The busload of sightseers encounters him as they do other objects of curiosity. At one point, the tour guide, a young woman, and the piper have a fling at dancing. It is a bus tour where everything is unexpected. Cast includes Don Ares, Cheryl Davis, Ron Sutherland. Photography by Thomas Vamos. Edited by Donald Rennick. Sound by Ted Haley, Claude Hazanavicius, Victor Merrill.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Derek May, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: One out of three is a fsihboat
results.creator_credit: Andy Thomson, Robert Verrall, Wolf Koenig and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A hard-hitting film suggesting that new attitudes and practices are needed in Canada’s fishing industry to protect the lives and property of those who work at sea. Accidents due to the unsafe condition of boats, bad habits of seamanship, fire or defects in safety equipment can be avoided. A ship safety inspector and instructors at New Brunswick’s School of Fisheries and Newfoundland’s College of Fisheries show where the roots of disaster can lie.

results.title: One man's garden
results.creator_credit: Donald Winkler, Desmond Dew and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A tongue-in-cheek film, a mixture of documentary and dramatic effect, on the subject of garbage in general and, in particular, the part it plays in the life of a young man named Simon, cast in the role of a latter-day Adam. His fateful act of tossing away an apple core sets in motion all we know about litter, waste, garbage dumps, and the most recent development, recycling.

results.title: One man's challenge
results.creator_credit: George Noordhof, Derek Stewart Productions, Peter Carden and Empire Rheumatism Council
results.brief_description: The story of a man crippled by rheumatoid arthritis and his struggle to overcome some of the effects of his disability. To-day, much can be done by hospital and patient to arrest development of the disease.

results.title: One man
results.creator_credit: Robin Spry, Michael Scott and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A red-hot story of corporate negligence sends ace-reporter Jason Brady into battle against big business, as well as against himself. But can he risk his world—his marriage, his job and possibly the lives of his family and himself—to save innocent children from the devastating effects of industrial pollution? Can one man buck the system and still survive? This gripping drama sensitively portrays one man’s confrontation with himself, his ideals and the realities around him.

results.title: One little indian [B/W]
results.creator_credit: Grant Munro, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A puppet film that wraps up some traffic safety rules in an absorbing story about a little Indian boy who pays his first visit to a big city. Even though Magic Bow is endowed with magic gifts and thrills the rodeo audience with his act, the whirl of traffic outside the arena leaves him completely bewildered. From kindly city folk he learns some basic safety precautions.

results.title: One little indian
results.creator_credit: Grant Munro, Colin Low, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A puppet film that wraps up some traffic safety rules in an absorbing story about a little Indian boy who pays his first visit to a big city. Even though Magic Bow is endowed with magic gifts and thrills the rodeo audience with his act, the whirl of traffic outside the arena leaves him completely bewildered. From kindly city folk he learns some basic safety precautions. (Presented with discussion in Window on Canada No. 69: How to Stay Alive on the Road, 106B 0156 132.) (Six awards, including Rapallo; New York.)

results.title: Noah's Ark
results.creator_credit: Bill Justice and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: An updated version of the story of Noah’s Ark, which will trigger children’s interest in biblical stories and initiate classroom discussion. The film is inventive in its use of three-dimensional animation techniques that would be of special interest to film study classes.
